website_summaries.verdict: A lightweight, durable and economical acoustic guitar bag that provides plenty of space for your guitar and gear.
pros: High-quality nylon construction ensures long-lasting quality
Two adjustable padded shoulder straps make it easy to transport your guitar
Multiple zippered pockets provide ample space for cords and other guitar gear
cons: Offers limited wiggle room for your instrument
Large acoustic guitars won't necessarily fit

customer_reviews.title: Great gig bag for Les Paul!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best inexpensive gig bag for a Les Paul. I've purchased and returned (2) others - the $20 Epiphone bag (terrible!) and $24 Gator (better than Epi bag but no where near as good as the ChromaCast, ). The ChromaCast is heavy duty nylon, has a larger, tougher zipper and many pockets. The straps are padded and the bag will protect my Epiphone Les Paul Standard as well as any gig bag. If you're going on tour you should use a hard shell case, but if all you need is a gig bag, this one is excellent. I have not received any merchandise for free or at a discount for any of my opinions/reviews!
customer_reviews.author: imho

customer_reviews.title: Better than others for twice the cost. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using gig bags for years. Most of them are pretty standard. I needed a bag extra quick for cheap for a used bass I just purchased. Bought the ChromeCast not expecting much. I've owned both the SKB World Tour and Road Runner cases. This one surprisingly is better than all three. It's built better, has a lot of pockets, and all the zippers and pockets are solid and work well. Like another reviewer mentioned, the case came rolled in a square box rather than folded. So it laid out nice and was usable on first try. I'm buying two more of these for my working basses. They do a great job and are well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: WC AlaskaTop Contributor: Bass Guitars & Gear

customer_reviews.title: Good bag
customer_reviews.text: Good bag. 2 mms padding, lots of pockets with zippers. Even has 3 ways of carrying/holding the bass. On the back/shoulder, on the side, and in the middle. Holds my full sized bass perfectly with good balance and comfort. Has pockets to fit my book and cable and mini amp if needed or wanted. Came rolled up in a medium box. Better than folded up with left over creases. The zippers took a little while to work right because the pockets weren't completely straight from packaging, but after a couple of zips they seem to be aligning, straightening up. Good bag. Also good with lots of pockets for about $20.
customer_reviews.author: Gina Moceri

customer_reviews.title: Don't overthink it just buy it
customer_reviews.text: Great value I see nothing to critique they're not made to protect from freight damage gentle carrying from car to gig. I have an Skb cost twice the amount does the same task has more pockets big deal
customer_reviews.author: Main Street Lou

customer_reviews.title: The bag itself is pretty good, great for the price
customer_reviews.text: The bag itself is pretty good, great for the price. My only issue was that with constant use (a few times a day) the strap's start to disconnect. Either the metal bracket bends, or, the strap's slip out. It is a fixable issue, but when it first happened I almost dropped my guitar. The overall product is pretty good especially for it's price
customer_reviews.author: Vernon Wallis

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: This bag rip on the first day it was used. I bought it for my son, he liked the bag until the bottom of it rip. He was so disappointed. I think I got a defective guitar bag. I need a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Roxie

customer_reviews.title: Zippers will break almost immediately
customer_reviews.text: Zipper tabs crumbled in my hands when first pulled. One as soon as I touched it. Second upon one zip. Bag listed as jumbo. Definitely not for a jumbo. Smaller and shorter than other bags listed for dreadnauggt.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hage

customer_reviews.title: This is a really good gig bag for your guitar if you don't knock ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good gig bag for your guitar if you don't knock it around much & excellent if you need something at home to keep the dust off. I bought the Jumbo Gig Bag, took it out of the box & put my Epiphone EJ-200SCE Jumbo guitar in it. After stretching the bag & zippers a little bit it fit perfectly. I think the bag will stretch further after a few days. It's only $20 & a bargain for a gig bag. Please realize the padding is thin & only offers minimal protection, though you'll have pockets galore.. I rated it 5 stars because it fits my needs.
customer_reviews.author: BluesPiano88

customer_reviews.title: Protect Your Guitars and Ukuleles. These Are a Must!!
customer_reviews.text: These padded gig bags are absolutely essential. I have now purchased 4 of these bags. One for each of my Ukuleles and my Telecaster. I have found that the bags that often come with a new instrument are just too thin to be of any use. They have no padding will not offer any protection. These ChromaCast bags are perfect. They have very tough ballistic nylon covers and more than enough padding. The straps are convenient and comfortable. All the bags come with convenient pockets. The electric guitar bag comes with more zippered storage pockets than I honestly know what to do with. They are reasonable priced compared to other brands. Great value
customer_reviews.author: John Montero

customer_reviews.title: Best value!
customer_reviews.text: Is this a perfect bass case? No. Is the best case for the value? Without a doubt. Seriously, for 30 bucks this is as economic as they get. The padding is decent, the zipper nice and firm, the material durable, straps and handles are usable, and so many pockets! If you need something inexpensive home storage or for very basic hauling back in forth then this a great option. However, if you need some some serious protection for an expensive guitaror are traveling long distances then up for a thicker, harder case. Side note: ordered from NC Deals Online. Lightening fast shipping and top notch customer service. Would order from them again.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Garbage quality. Original unit and replacement are defective.
customer_reviews.text: After owning the original item for less than two months, the zipper tape on the large lower compartment came off and the zipper slider fell off. This happened within two months of light use. I messaged the company and got a replacement per its warranty. Now three months later the zipper on the large top compartment fell off in my hands. Stay away from this gig bag. This experience has left me wholly dissatisfied and feeling like I've wasted my money. Never again buying anything from ChromaCast.
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased a 3/4-size classical guitar for my grandson. He takes lessons, so I knew he'd need a decent gig bag to transport said guitar. I've purchased a couple of ChromaCast gig bags and always found them to be well-worth the money. They use good nylon material and put in enough padding to protect the instrument. In my grandson's case, the size of the bag is snug enough to keep the guitar from moving around, yet large enough for him to get it in the bag without having to jam it in. For the money, I would say ChromaCast gives you the most bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.author: B. Swenson

customer_reviews.title: Much better than what I was expecting
customer_reviews.text: I just needed a cheap synthetic bag to slow down moisture loss (evaporation) from humidifiers. I can't afford hard cases for all my guitars so this is the next best thing. It came stuffed into a small plastic bag. The entire gig bag was stuffed down to the size of a football, so I was thinking it was going to be really thin material and too small for my guitar, but out of the bag, I was surprised by the size and quality. The gig bag is good enough to be used for light travel to and from gigs. It will protect you guitar from scratches, sunlight, and light impacts. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Adam A. Wynn

customer_reviews.title: Not for odd shaped guitars
customer_reviews.text: It looks good and the two I received are perfect. One houses my Les Paul... the other my Fender. Good price... good value... and it meets my needs just fine. It may not appeal to those who drag their guitar from one gig to the next... but give it a try. You may be surprised. V shaped and Explorer shaped guitars will not fit in this bag. Now I'm gonna see if this company makes a bass case like these. Jam as much as you can and always have fun even if you are not at the top of the music chain. It's all about the music.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Hill

customer_reviews.title: It works...
customer_reviews.text: The adage, "you get what you pay for" bodes well with this gig bag. While it's not terrible, it is not great. My favorite part is the storage capacity. There is plenty of room for cables, a pair of pedal, papers and more. I like that it has several large pockets for my gear. It is a bit baggy for my Fender American Precision bass which leads to when placing it on the floor it completely misses the shock absorber and thuds on the ground. So I place it lightly on the ground or subway platform. It certainly has its plusses and minuses but for commuting to jams in NYC this bag is pretty good and great for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Damian Panitz

customer_reviews.title: NOT for Epiphone EB-0 Bass!
customer_reviews.text: The neck area of this bag is too skinny for the head stock of an EB-0. The zipper doesn't want to clear the edges of the tuning keys. Also, the interior material is very crinkly, crunchy. Don't think it is nylon, maybe really cheap polyester. It reminded me of a child's Halloween vampire cape from a dollar store. Never seen that kind of material inside a bag before. I think it would crack, definitely not great for your guitar's finish. I returned the bag. Amazon customer service was excellent in processing the return.
customer_reviews.author: K. Parker

customer_reviews.title: Serviceable, but hardware broke quickly
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this bag for our son, who plays bass in middle school band. He rides the bus, and carries this around with him during the day - the bag gets heavy use. After a week, the metal clamps that held the shoulder straps to the case broke. We've tied them off, and he no longer wears the case - but they're thin pieces of metal. They didn't survive very long in field use... If you're looking for something to keep dust off the instrument this will do it, or if you only transport your bass once in a blue moon it's probably fine. If you actually travel with it, don't rely on this as a solution.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly T

customer_reviews.title: Go for it!!
customer_reviews.text: Guys, if you really like your guitar, then go ahead and purchase this gig bag.. sturdy, strong zippers, several bags to storage your items and fit like a sock the body of your guitar. I have another 7 guitars and all of them will get an upgrade with this bag, needless to say that bag arrives in 2 days in a bag with all labels of the product stating a never-used-before gig bag. And for the price??? Gator, better to decrease your price and increase quality or these guys will make you to lose some more business... cheers \,,/
customer_reviews.author: Aramis C.

customer_reviews.title: Quality comes cheap!
customer_reviews.text: Needed a case for a very inexpensive Maestro electric guitar I recently purchased on Amazon so I did not want to spend much money. I paid only $16 for this case so I did not expect much. I was very surprised when I received it. Quality made thick padded vinyl case with heavy duty zippers and plenty of extra storage compartments all with the same heavy duty zippered closures. It can be carried by a side handle like a suitcase or on your back with backpack style straps that are also available on this case. I highly recommend this case to all electric guitar owners who do not want to spend a lot of money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, but good for basic protection of your guitars.
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these. They are priced so cheap for a gig bag, but so far I have no complaints. Some nice touches are convenient handle placement, rubber padding in the base and many pockets. I think it'll do just fine for light duty and basic protection. It will by no means protect guitars from hard falls and probably won't withstand rigorous touring. I wouldn't use this as main storage for a nicer guitar either (get a real case), but for temporary storage or for "beater" guitars it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: fuquan

customer_reviews.title: Fast, Efficient, Heavily Padded and Roomy
customer_reviews.text: I'm finding it to fit most guitars, It also has a wealth of pockets to make you highly organized, They're roomy and have more than enough space, The pockets have that silky soft material found in Laptop cases, The order itself was packed tight in bag (doesn't really need packing material cause it's not fragile) and the order was delivered super fast as per usual when selected prime item with 2 day shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Donald Flowers

customer_reviews.title: Ugly at first glance - but what a great gig bag!
customer_reviews.text: My original impression was that this was a seriously ugly gig bag with all of those pockets (maybe six of them?) bulging out along one side. However, the designer of this bag got the last laugh. I use every one of those pockets! It has turned out to be a great gig bag with a great set of sturdy shoulder straps so you can sling it over your back. The bag itself is a snug fit on my Stratocaster, but I am still extraordinarily happy I have it.
customer_reviews.author: Neat_Stuff

customer_reviews.title: After two more times used the main zipper broke now making it completely useless. The case looks great
customer_reviews.text: After the case was used approx two times (not even carrying it an distance) the strap broke. I was able to fix the metal part with pliers and tie the strap around with a knot. After two more times used the main zipper broke now making it completely useless. The case looks great, like new still, either we got a lemon or the quality did not hold up at all. It was inexpensive so I guess you get what you pay for but it would of been nice to be able to use it for a year. It was only used approx. 4 times total.
customer_reviews.author: Michael W. Untermeyer

customer_reviews.title: It's fine, lots of pockets, a bit larger than as stated in description...
customer_reviews.text: It is a fine case, especially for the price. The interior dimensions are much closer to -- ----------------------------------- Large Bout - 17 3/4", Small Bout - 13 3/4", Depth - 4 3/4", Length - 42", Body Length - ~ 20 3/4" . My guitar is ~ 37 3/4" long, figured 1 1/2" would be a safe oversize... but 4" OverSize ??? for length and 3" OverSize for width and body length??? But I am just nitpicking... still I may be able to fit a standard guitar in this case.
customer_reviews.author: Teleosus

customer_reviews.title: Save your money for a better quality case.
customer_reviews.text: This case is certainly a case of "you get what you pay for." The sturdy zippers and the number of pockets are great features, but that's about it. It offers no actual protection for your instrument, so be very careful transporting it in this case. The shoulder straps have come loose because the metal ring attaching it at the bottom of the case has bent, opening the d-ring and allowing the strap to slip out. Save your money for a better quality case.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Cheap components wreck but could be a nice product.
customer_reviews.text: Hardware including zipper pulls and shoulder strap harness are poorly made and do not hold up. Within three months my first Chromecast gig bag zippers failed. I Purchased the second one and the first time using it the hardware that connects the shoulder straps gave out. I would not recommend this product to anyone who needs a reliable method of transporting their instrument.
customer_reviews.author: Dave 3

customer_reviews.title: This is the one you want
customer_reviews.text: I frankly wasn't expecting much. I just needed a bag for my kick around guitar. This is a great gig bag! The stitching on mine was good, handles where I need them and PLENTY of pockets for music and accessories. For this price you just can't go wrong. The backpack straps arr padded which makes a HUGE difference if you have to walk any distance. I ordered another one for my son. Edit : 3_28/2019 received second gigbag today. Just as awesome as the first. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Monique J.

customer_reviews.title: Recommend and will buy more.
customer_reviews.text: Good case, great value. At this price point you can't beat it. You can go to guitar center and give them 10$ more for a much lesser gig bag but I've learned my lesson . my bags are generally used just as a dust cover but these bags are padded enough to feel comfortable taking it anywhere as long as its separated from the heavy gear. Currently have 3 of these bags and as the collection grows I will purchase more.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: WTF
customer_reviews.text: Send me the wrong one with a gross spider design all over it. Super thin and crappy too.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Poorly Made
customer_reviews.text: Zipper broke the first time I used it with my Jazz bass, which this case is NOT too small to fit, so that shouldn't have been a problem. It's just poorly made. I would return it but of course I didn't need to use this gig bag until after the return window had closed, so now I'm stuck with a useless gig bag.
customer_reviews.author: Robert C.Top Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: A Customer for Life!
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how good, correction, GREAT, this case is. The fabric is thick, the stitching is great and there are plenty of pockets. I don't know how they do it for such a reasonable price but please keep doing it. As an avid guitar collector I always need cases so now I know where to go and I won't go anywhere else. I'm a customer for life! Thank you!!
customer_reviews.author: Tibor O.

customer_reviews.title: Great guitar bag. A good value.
customer_reviews.text: This bag is great! I was actually impressed with how sturdy it is. Material is heavy duty. Padding is pretty good. More than adequate for shuffling my guitar around. (I still opt to keep my $$ guitar in a hard case. BTW ChromaCast has a cheap one of those too if you want to go that route). This bag seems well thought out, is reinforced in key places, has a handy pocket, heavy duty handle, and back-pack style straps. Not the most comfortable option, but still nice to have. I will seriously consider other ChromaCast products after this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good bag, But, WILL NOT FIT A JAZZ BASS
customer_reviews.text: I like this case, I've ordered many ChromaCast gig bags before, and they've all been fine. BUT this bass gig bag WILL NOT FIT A JAZZ BASS. They give you the dimensions, so I can't fault them on that, and so it is my bad, but I wish there had been more of a disclaimer, as Jazz basses are not that uncommon. So, I will recycle the two I ordered to my friends with P-basses, and the price wasn't huge, so I won't quibble, but be thee forewarned...WILL NOT FIT A JAZZ BASS.
customer_reviews.author: Mister B

customer_reviews.title: Fits my Ibanez GSR200 great!
customer_reviews.text: I had been lugging around my bass guitar in a generic hard shell case that didn’t hold my guitar in place at all. Decided to go with a better fitting soft shell as I don’t really need to move it from one place to another very often and it would do the job. This case is excellent. The quality feels great and it fits my guitar perfectly. I’d buy it again in a heartbeat if I had the need.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great Gig Bag, overall quality is great. I like the two big compartments for notebooks and the velcro neck strap inside the case to keep your guitar in place. There is more padding in this case than my old one its replacing. I would definitely recommend and buy again. Thank you ChromaCast and GoDpsMusic.
customer_reviews.author: The Silver Shroud

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty with Plenty of Pockets
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new gig bag for the Tele Copy I use for our blues band. I looked on Amazon the ChromaCast bag seemed like a reasonable price. When it arrived, I was delighted to discover that I had ordered the perfect bag for my "Tele" and all the extras I need when I perform. They conveniently fit into various well made zipper pockets. Mic and guitar cables, mic, extra strings, song lists, tools and CD's of the band all fit nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Seymour

customer_reviews.title: Happy Husband
customer_reviews.text: My husband is a guitarist for a local rock band. He performs in shows, and he's trying to grow his guitar collection. This bag is cheaper but works great for transporting his electric guitar from one place to another. It has a decent amount of padding, and he's happy with it. We will probably purchase this again for his next guitar. :)
customer_reviews.author: KaitLynn

customer_reviews.title: To and From Practice - No Problem
customer_reviews.text: Son needed something to get his Ibanez RX to and from lessons. This fit the bill perfectly. It's a perfect fit and decent quality with enough padding and protection for riding around in the back seat. Not overly padded like some of my more expensive cases (that would not fit this guitar) but good enough at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: dancingchicken

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Very nice. Glad I got 2. One for my 12 year old and one for my wife. Both will be happy with their new cases. Shipping was funny. As of now, while writing this review, they are still in USPS La La Land but they arrived today. Not sure what has happened to USPS but they are lagging on everything. Anyway, several pockets for everything they need to carry with them. Has a carrying handle and can be worn as a backpack. Cases seem to be made very well and should hold up to years of abuse. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little bag!
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand the negative reviews. Great bag considering the price. If you need a bag to keep around the house or occasionally throw in the back seat of your car, this is perfect . If you plan on severe use, then buy some thing different. I don't understand you negative people talking about broken zippers or dropping you instrument. If you carry the bag by the handle there is no way it can fall out. the backstraps could be a little heavier. but what do you want for $20?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great case for moving a guitar and all its accessories
customer_reviews.text: This case has more pockets than I have stuff to put in them. It's also super easy to carry my guitar around with those backpack strap. Literally just slip it on and go. I also like the cushioning to keep it from being damaged (as long as you don't throw it at the wall) and the strap inside to hold the neck in place so its not loose in the bag. Great case for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: honestly a horrible product lol
customer_reviews.text: VERY mediocre product. The straps are held on by one weak piece of metal, that instantly snapped in half a week after use. Tried repairing it to no avail. The fabric basically ripped out with the broken metal, it’s a complete waste of my time and money, and put my instrument in danger, as it snapped while I was on a packed moving train in the city. tldr; SPEND THE EXTRA MONEY ON A SAFE CASE FOR YOUR INSTRUMENT. THIS IS NOT IT.
customer_reviews.author: Goona

customer_reviews.title: Excellent protection for your electric guitar
customer_reviews.text: I love these ChromaCast electric guitar padded gig bags. They fit just about every electric guitar I've tried them with, Fenders, Gretschs, Sterlings, and Squiers. The extra pockets leave room for cables, picks, books, or even a Fly Rig Tech 21 if you happen to carry one! I highly recommend these gig bags.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Far better than I expected for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely more than I expected for the price. I needed something to protect my bass (a Spector Performer Series) from casual local gig to gig travel. This fits the bill perfectly. It seems to be well-made. All the zippers work, plenty of pockets to stash goodies. Would I trust it as checked baggage in the compartment of a bus or plane? Definitely not. But as protection to and from rehearsals and gigs where I can make sure it's stowed on top of heavier gear, I'd trust it to do its job.
customer_reviews.author: DavejustDave

customer_reviews.title: Made for a toy guitar
customer_reviews.text: Not wide enough or long enough, doesn't fit at all. Looks like it's made for an electric guitar if you have a small toy one. Quality is ok, but the way it comes rolled up is not the greatest. Doesn't matter anyway because I can't use it at all. Torn between going through the hassle of returning it or throwing it away.
customer_reviews.author: Fishnmusicn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit and snug protection for my oddly shaped lefty ABG
customer_reviews.text: I have a LEFT-HANDED Kramer-Ferrington acoustic bass guitar. Lefty's in general are tough to fit into gig bags, but this beast was impossible. I used to bring it to gigs in a gigantic keyboard gig bag. This fits it perfectly and has ample room in the pockets for everything I need to bring on a gig. I really couldn't be happier with this gig bag, and I've started giving lesser gig bags I use for other instruments some serious side-eye.
customer_reviews.author: lefty

customer_reviews.title: Superb, high quality, convenient
customer_reviews.text: They spared no detail with this bag. It has everything: -Plenty of pockets, even pockets for your pockets -A securing strap for your guitar -handles in every thinkable spot for convenient carrying all-around, including a harness that lets you carry it on your back like a bookbag Get this bag, it is very high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Julius

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, seems good but appeared open/used
customer_reviews.text: Great fit for a smaller sized regular guitar (not 3/4 or kids model) for the Fender 135. Missing tags but plastic attachment was on and packaged was taped in a a way that it appeared used/open prior. Great price. Keeping as it is a very good fit.
customer_reviews.author: Tool Guy

customer_reviews.title: Very good bag with plenty of pockets
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag - very well made, fits the guitar perfectly, and I am glad it has so many pockets! When I ordered the bag I didn't pay any attention to it, but it came in handy when I realized I need to carry all the gadgets with me - tuner, capo, picks, cord, etc. Happy with the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Jack M.

customer_reviews.title: Good fit, strong zippers, book bag straps
customer_reviews.text: Just got it. Looks good.....zipper looks good, durability appears good(meaning that looks and feels like it will last long, appears to be constructed well). My guitar fit fine, I was worried about being 1 inch off. 2 handles you can grasp it with , or, it has book bag straps. I like the extra pouches....I’ll make use of those.
customer_reviews.author: ALI

customer_reviews.title: Great Gig Bag
customer_reviews.text: Lots of storage. Sturdy and protective. Great price. My only complaint is that it came folded in a small box so bag was creased in two places. Easy fix. I just stored another instrument in it for awhile. I would definitely purchase this item again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: T L R

customer_reviews.title: Fit my Cordoba C5 classical guitar perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Classical style guitar can be hard to fit with a gig bag as they have smaller bouts and shorter lengths. This accoustic mini fit my C5 like a glove. Very high quality built too (without being overly bulky) . I don;t know how they can build this bag for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Second Verse as good as the first...
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Chromacast soft case. These cases are a great value. Very tough material, zippers and storage. I purchased one for a guitar, and this one is for my bass. It sits an Ibanez SR400 series full size bass with room to spare.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Troiani

customer_reviews.title: It is totally useless and I had to buy a brand new case
customer_reviews.text: The very first time I put my new guitar in this case the zipper split as soon as it was zipped up. So I unzipped it and rezipped it and it was ok untill the next time I had to zip it up and again the zipper splits and does not stay zipped at all. It is totally useless and I had to buy a brand new case. No zippers this time. Horrible product. So unreliable it could damage your guitar. I would not even put a toy guitar in this thing. I also won't donate it because I would worry it would damage someone else's guitar.
customer_reviews.author: tkwalther

customer_reviews.title: ... a couple weeks or so ago and was very happy when I opened it up with the quality
customer_reviews.text: I received this a couple weeks or so ago and was very happy when I opened it up with the quality. I am taking a trip and just put my guitar in it which is an Epiphone Full bodied Acoustic. It fits in the case great! It also has a velcro strap up by the neck to hold the guitar nice. If that is not enough the compartments hold a lot of stuff. Even has a long compartment about the length of the neck to fit a foldable guitar stand. AWESOME!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Mina

customer_reviews.title: Not what expected.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice guitar case, but it's for a small guitar. The word "jumbo" is used in the description. It is not at all a "jumbo" size so beware! If you own a 3/4 size guitar it should fit fine. Be sure to measure before ordering.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Osborn

customer_reviews.title: Better than Expected!
customer_reviews.text: Push the Buy It Now Button. Can’t go wrong with this bag. Exceeded my expectations. Just wanted a cheap gig bag for my road trip Strat. Just something to keep it from getting scratched up and a handle. Wow! This is more like. $50 to $75 bag found in stores. Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Rharan

customer_reviews.title: Decent purchase
customer_reviews.text: It’s a decent bag for the price you pay. Like most bags it doesn't offer much protection. It has lots of pockets which makes up for it. Not sure if the material will hold up over time though. The bag had a strong chemical smell to it and eventually went away after about a day or two.
customer_reviews.author: Persephonie

customer_reviews.title: Amazon saves the Day
customer_reviews.text: Had to return because it wasn't long enough for the neck of the Bass guitar. Be sure you check the length so you won't have a disappointed teen when they receive a gift and it doesn't fit so you have to wait for the other one to arrive. But thanks to Amazon it was exchanged in just two days.
customer_reviews.author: BeckyMay

customer_reviews.title: Form-Fitting for Fender, Fails for Fat Firefly
customer_reviews.text: Expectations were exceeded. Offers a totally acceptable amount of padding for a gig bag, quality seems excellent for the $$, pockets are a great bonus. Telecaster fits nicely, but this particular model is far too small for a Firefly 338.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca M.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy & good value.
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this bag. It has enough pockets he can carry cords, music sheets, and bass guitar all in one bag. The seams are holding up well and the bag appears to do its job. The strap is comfortable and works well with the bag.
customer_reviews.author: PK4 Teacher & Mom

customer_reviews.title: Quality and capacity
customer_reviews.text: You won’t be disappointed with the quality and capacity of this case. If I were to change one thing it would be that it does not unzip to where you could lay it open. This is a minor thing and I would not hesitate to purchase again. I have other Chromacast cases that have held up over two years now.
customer_reviews.author: BdLip

customer_reviews.title: Fits a schecter demon 6
customer_reviews.text: Fits my schecter demon 6 perfectly. For the price it can’t be beat. It works to keep the guitar clean and from getting dinged up. Has a lot of pockets and zippers. Fits my guitar, cable, bag of picks and a few sets of spare strings, and I can fit loads more.
customer_reviews.author: aldo vargas

customer_reviews.title: Best guitar case Ive used.
customer_reviews.text: Oh my God! I love this guitar case. The material is very thick so it's very sturdy. It has 5 or 6 pockets and 1 opening for the guitar. The pockets are very nice, the zippers are great and dont feel like they would break. However my favorite part is the straps. Every guitar bag I have ever used, the straps always end up breaking. The straps on this guitar case are like straps on a book bag. They are such good quality I would buy it for them.
customer_reviews.author: kenzie

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: These are good gig bags for their price range. Good size, lots of storage. I use them for my cheaper guitars and they are good enough for that. For my Fender or Gretsch, I'll use a quality hardshell case. They arrived a week late.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: INCREDIBLE! Go with this option for basic protection/transportation.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, well constructed material - especially for the price. I only needed protection for my Fender Strat for a road trip x-country and basic transportation in and out of my vehicle. I wasn't expecting such sturdy quality and also really enjoy being able to use all the pockets for my cord and picks and stuff. Fits my stratocaster quite snuggly. No real expectation for my guitar to keep its tuning throughout the multiple trips - but for the most part it help true about 90 percent of the time. Fast shipping, reliable quality - would recommend 5 out of 5!
customer_reviews.author: Ezra M.

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag for the price
customer_reviews.text: This bag is nice for carrying my bass, it makes it a whole lot easier. If you need a bag and don't want to spend a lot this is the bag for you. It's not as padded as more expensive cases, but if your instrument is getting tossed around get a hardshell! One of the zippers didn't come with a handle but it's not a big of a deal.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan D. Knutson

customer_reviews.title: Stoked On This Soft Case
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my disgustingly talented husband who plays so often in LA that a hard case just wasn’t cutting it. He has nothing against the brand but he was happy that the logo was small so he could put black tape over it and put his name and contact info just “in case” ;) He loves all the pockets and I’ve even worn it a few times with his bass in it and it’s not too heavy for me compared to his hard case. WIN WIN!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Landers

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and value
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised by the quality. Really nice. You feel it when you pack up. Great storage as well. Comes in real handy when toting my basses between practice, gigs and home. Obviously lighter than a case. Wish I did this years ago. One downside (but I really dont care) is that they are not fitted. They are more like the relaxed fit jeans as opposed to slim fit.
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Great bag for traveling... I already have one for my 3/4 guitar... But, I wanted one for my larger guitars... The hard cases are much heavier when traveling... I love all of the handy pockets for picks, stand, capo, and any other accessories... 😊
customer_reviews.author: millie hobson

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: It's not as padded as a Fender deluxe bag, but it's more padded than the junk bags I've seen. I use it all the time and still protect my guitar. Zippers still work great. I wouldn't use it for a $3k guitar, but it's great for my cheaper guitars.
customer_reviews.author: Ronn

customer_reviews.title: Fits a Yamaha APX T2
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the 3/4 size acoustic bag to fit a Yamaha APX T2. The Chromacast bag is very nice and fits well, with a couple inches wiggle room inside. Plenty of pockets for picks, capo, strap, ETC and still small enough to be unobtrusive in an overhead bin on a plane. A very nice gig bag for minimal cash and exactly what I wanted. Ships rolled up in a plastic bag, just stuff your guitar in it when you get it, and it will work it's way straight overnight. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Easy

customer_reviews.title: Fits Ibanez Bass Perfectly!  Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Fits my Ibanez Bass just right. Love the extra storage pockets that can hold cords + FX boxes + power supplies, no problem! Backpack straps are really sturdy + are adjustible to fit. Great protection overall. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Linda L.

customer_reviews.title: Good gig bag!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good gig bag for a 00 size, LG (14 fret concert) size, classical 12 fret concert) size, and small archtop size guitars. I have one for each size guitar. Their padding is adequate for a gig bag. Better than I thought it would be.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: kinda wonky
customer_reviews.text: THis is a weird bag because it provides good support in certain places, but my strat still has room to flop around and take hard blows at various angles with little support. not a very confidence-inducing fit
customer_reviews.author: Sebastian

customer_reviews.title: Good value bag
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good bag for the price. The only complaint would be the stitching is not the most durable, but it's also not so cheap you have to worry about it splitting. Take care of it, it will take care of you.
customer_reviews.author: The Badger

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: My son has a jazz bass guitar and I was worried it wasn't going to fit. I was so happy to discover that it fit perfectly! It has pockets for accessories and sheet music and backpack-like straps to carry it comfortably. It's also padded nicely. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Yana B Real

customer_reviews.title: Great value, best price, similar to $40-$60 bags
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to buy this bass gig bag based on the low price. I was surprised, it is on par with the $40+ gig bags I have had in the past. People might be skeptical because it's made in China, but guess what?-almost all of them are. I hope the zippers hold up. Some of the pockets are unnecessary and the skinny long one on the neck is impossible to get an arm to the bottom. I wish the main big pocket was large enough for a music binder, but whatever. Great for the price. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: jonathan clark

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised!
customer_reviews.text: This was a fairly inexpensive gig bag for an acoustic bass, but I just needed something for "basic" protection. I was TOTALLY surprised with the quality and ruggedness of this product! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JacobJordan

customer_reviews.title: Fits all long scale solid body electric bass guitars.
customer_reviews.text: While designed for long scale, it works with short scale solid body basses. It has straps to carry on your back and a handle to carry it vertically instead of swinging it around corners in the horizontal position. Plenty of pockets for cords and accessories. Not overly padded, but protects the guitar from hard surface contact when transporting your bass.
customer_reviews.author: Don  K

customer_reviews.title: High quality at reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Nothing to dislike about this gig bag, everything to like!! The quality of this bag surpasses gig bags costing much more. I couldn't be more pleased with this purchase however I'm very unhappy I went to Guitar Center firs. I needed 3 gig bags, GC only had two for $25.00 each. Needing one more my daughter suggested Amazon. I found this at a lower price than the very thin non-padded bags I bought at GC. Don't make the same mistake buy this bag from Amazon
customer_reviews.author: bill price

customer_reviews.title: Nice Gig Bag!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent case, lots of useful pockets for music, strings, cables and a long one at the top end that could hold your fold up music or guitar stand. Well padded, good hardware. Two sturdy handles and back pack straps. ChromaCast guitar and drum products are well engineered and well made: Amazon Prime's free delivery and low prices makes it for me.
customer_reviews.author: Bob E.Top Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Love these bags
customer_reviews.text: I have a bunch of the guitar gig bags and needed a bass one, so this brand was my first choice and it's as good as the others I already have. Very nice padding, great zippers and lots of storage.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Rhody

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: You do get what you pay for. This is adequate to keep dust off a guitar in the house, but it offers very little protection. The guitar slides sounds inside and would not stand even a small drop.... For the price it is what it is.
customer_reviews.author: Traveling Man

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: Great bag! Sturdy enough to go to local jam night. Practice with friends etc. Enough padding for that purpose. This also has a loop, on the back, near the head. Either to carry or hang!
customer_reviews.author: Kenny

customer_reviews.title: Great bag. Could have better zipper.
customer_reviews.text: Great bag! Does everything we hoped. The padding is enough to protect without being too bulky. It is being used by a 15-year-old boy and is holding up well after a couple months. My only complaint is the zipper should be smoother to operate and needs larger zipper grasp. I thought it was just from being new that it was stiff to operate but it's not. It is not as smooth of a zipper as it should be. Maybe bigger size would help.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Great for light transport
customer_reviews.text: Generally my strat stays at home, but having to carry it back and forth for a few days i needed a cheap bag that wouldn't fall apart. The guitar fit snugly which was was perfect for casual transport. If you're looking for lots of padding and protection then this isn't for you. However, if you need something simple with plenty of storage and a little protection from bumps and dings - this is ideal. The shoulder straps are thin but comfortable, and were helpful for carting the guitar on my back through the office, without hitting every door frame in the process.
customer_reviews.author: Schlock

customer_reviews.title: Perfect guitar case
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son and his 3/4 acoustic guitar fits perfectly! It's nicely padded, has 3 options to hold it and lots of storage compartments. I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Sharp

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional Value for my Duo Sonic Offset
customer_reviews.text: For the cost, IMHO, it can't be beat! What a great bag...GOBS of storage pockets, very decent nylon, nice zippers, well padded, carry handle stitched across entire bag, couldn't be more pleased. I used it for a 2017 Fender Duo Sonic Offset and it fit perfectly. Slightly large in the bout, but the length is exactly the right fit. It was hard to find an inexpensive, soft gig bag for this inexpensive guitar that wasn't garbage. There's plenty of gig bags out there that cost a heck of a lot more, but for my needs, this fit the bill perfectly
customer_reviews.author: R. M.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Semi Hollowbody Style Electric Guitar
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for an ES-355 style hollow body style guitar and it fit just perfectly! That is what I was looking for so I got lucky. They should mention this in their description. It's probably very tight or small for a standard dreadnaught style acoustic but slightly deeper than a standard solid body electric would need. They should advertise it for hollow bodies and semi hollow bodies as it's perfect for them. fyi mine is an Ibanez AS73.
customer_reviews.author: Atlanta Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality case on a budget
customer_reviews.text: Good product with lots of pockets! I just wish the big pocket on the outside was large enough for a music folder, but I guess you can't have everything :/ Pretty durable and I like how there's two handles for carrying it around. You really can't go wrong with this product. It would be cool if they made more designs later on!
customer_reviews.author: shuyi kuo

customer_reviews.title: Love this case!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this bag for her guitar! It has plenty of room, a pocket for her capo and extra picks, and a nice strap to carry it! It’s very sturdy! We would definitely buy this again!
customer_reviews.author: beks

customer_reviews.title: Well built with lots of storage
customer_reviews.text: This is a great value for the price. I'm able to store my guitar and accessories in the bag with room to spare. Much nicer than the more expensive Road Runner bag I previously purchased.
customer_reviews.author: ASE13

customer_reviews.title: Not enough padding to be a serious gig bag
customer_reviews.text: I had read many good reviews and thought I would give it a shot. It arrived and when I saw the size of the box from Amazon... I knew the reviews and the price were too good to be true. The bag is fine but not if you use it protect your bass from bumps. It just does not have enough padding, sorry to say and back it went to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Amico

customer_reviews.title: Durable padded gig bag at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I use this to store one of my expensive guitars. It’s well padded and it has the extra handle on the front that I really like. I have actually purchased two of these as I liked the first one so well. For the money I think it is very hard to beat.
customer_reviews.author: James L. Shaw

customer_reviews.title: An Excellent Bass Bag
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive, nylon bag that is lightly padded and enough pockets to keep stuff organized. The nylon material, zippers and construction appear to be of good quality. My Fender Jazz bass fits snugly inside with no problem. I use my bag to store and protect my instrument from dust, sunlight and unwanted handling when resting against the wall. There are grips on the front and side as well as backpack style shoulder straps so it is designed for transporting as well. However, if my intent was to regularly transport my bass, I would consider a hard case for the ruggedness and added protection.
customer_reviews.author: Joe T

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for the price.
customer_reviews.text: 4 stars only because the durability factor is unknown...otherwise I love it. Lots of storage, well padded and easy to handle for local transport. Way better than wrapping your guitar in an old blanket!
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: CC-EPB-BAG
customer_reviews.text: My daughter got an electric guitar for her birthday. This works prefect. She loves all the extra pockets. Plenty of places for cords, picks, music and even a small amp.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Leer

customer_reviews.title: Not much padding
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a professional musician, or even a good musician at that, but I like to dabble. I recently got a Roland GR33 guitar synth and needed an electric guitar which I will review soon. This gig bag was really inexpensive and was surprisingly well made with large pockets for accessories. There isn't much padding, so if you do a lot of moving around and performing, you'll probably want a better one with more padding. Pros: Good quality material. Well made. Inexpensive. Cons: Not much padding.
customer_reviews.author: IShopOnLine

customer_reviews.title: Worked for an Ibanez
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for an Ibanez electric bass and was worried it would not be large enough based on other reviews. We were pleasantly surprised. It fit like s glove and is easy for our son to carry his bass back and forth to school.
customer_reviews.author: TNSara

product_meta.title: ChromaCast CC-APB-BAG Acoustic Guitar Padded Gig Bag
product_meta.description: Size:Acoustic GuitarDurable nylon padded acoustic guitar Gig Bag with easy grip handle and adjustable padded shoulder straps. Features 3 front pockets that will hold all your necessary guitar accessories and an additional extra long pocket that can house a universal collapsible guitar stand. This rugged and durable gig bag is perfect for the traveling musician.
feature_bullets: Exterior dimensions: 43" Length x 13.5" (Upper bout)/ 17" (Lower bout) Width x 4" Height
Interior dimensions: 42.5" Length x 13" (Upper bout)/ 16"(lower bout) Width x 4" Height

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars2,101 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
